overview_of_class: Econometrics is about using data to infer relations among economic variables. This course is about how to use data and modern software to build, evaluate, and use models to answer such questions. It thereby lets students apply concepts and strategies from their econometrics coursework to real-world data. The course is taught in a computerized classroom. Each student sits at a computer terminal, which enables us to estimate and diagnose models in class. The course will cover exploratory data analysis, model selection and estimation, as well as interpretation and presentation of results Students will write a paper describing the analysis of a real data set and the conclusions reached from that analysis.
name: Applied Econometrics
title: WCAS ECON 383-0-20 Applied Econometrics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Econometrics is about using data to infer relations among economic variables. This course is about how to use data and modern software to build, evaluate, and use models to answer such questions. It thereby lets students apply concepts and strategies from their econometrics coursework to real-world data. The course is taught in a computerized classroom. Each student sits at a computer terminal, which enables us to estimate and diagnose models in class. The course will cover exploratory data analysis, model selection and estimation, as well as interpretation and presentation of results Students will write a paper describing the analysis of a real data set and the conclusions reached from that analysis.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Two 80-minute lectures and a possible weekly discussion section.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Problem sets, Proposal and oral presentation of proposal, Paper and oral discussion of paper.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Introduction to Econometrics by Stock and Watson, 3rd Updated Edition. (ISBN:978-0133486872) Software: All computation will be with the econometric software package STATA. The software is available in the computerized classroom and the university's computer labs. A list of labs with Stata at http://www.it.northwestern.edu/education/complabs/index.html. You can purchase STATA for your own computer at http://www.stata.com/order/new/edu/gradplans/student-pricing/.

subject: ECON
